titleStmt.title: Moses Quisenberry et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4872

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Apr. 27, 1864
Handcock County Kentucky
Hon. Thos E Bramlett Governor of Ky
Petition }

We the undersigned Citizens of Handcock County some neighbors of Delany Sander's nowing that he was arriving at in the Handcock Circuit Court for building fence across public roads once no Said Court was fined Sixty two dols it appearing that the fence was across the said 62 days the penalty $1 per day. and we State that no injury whatever was done to the public. that the fence was only a few spaces from the old line wherefore the Road was not moved any of consequences and was moved on just as good grounds as it was on at first the ground was perfectly level. where the new road runs. We further State that Sander's is a poor man has a family to Support, and that we believe that he ough to be justly Relieved of this fine as there was no public injury inflicted by the Removeal of the road. Wherefore we as law biding citizens humbly petition your excellency as Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky. having the power to Reprieve to Relieve Said Sanders of Said
fine as we think he ought to be as true and impartial citizens of Ky. and have here unto Subscribed our Permis. this 29th day of April 1864

P. S.
we further State that the information in this case against Sander's was caused by personal judgmt.

Moses quisenberry
James tompson
robert marton
David ewan
A Sanders
James J boling
James Boling Sr
John Boling
James W. Newton
G W Williams
N Hardmen
J A Nation
T Dawson
Geo Ball
H. humerpey
Milton Sanders
James Kelley
David freels
D S Sanders
James S Boling
Asberry Boling
Beachum Boling
Henry Boling
John A Sanders
John quisenberry

Address. Delany Sander's Hugg's Creek
Handcock County Ky
